intro: Leptadenia delilei, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by follicles containing seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Leptadenia delilei is also known for its latex sap, which has been used traditionally for various purposes.
